security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure read-only API client for the Open Targets Platform biomedical database. The static scanner produced 152 false positives primarily by misclassifying markdown code formatting backticks as shell commands, biomedical terminology as system reconnaissance, and variable names containing 'crypt' as weak cryptography. The actual Python code only makes GraphQL requests to https://api.platform.opentargets.org/api/v4/graphql with no filesystem access, command execution, or data exfiltration. All behavior matches the stated purpose of querying therapeutic target data.

low_findings.reasoning: Legitimate use of requests library to query public Open Targets API
Official Open Targets Platform API endpoint documented in code

content.user_title: Query Open Targets for drug targets
content.value_statement: Find therapeutic targets and drug candidates using integrated genetic, omics, and clinical data. Query gene-disease associations with evidence scores to accelerate drug discovery.
actual_capabilities: Query gene-disease associations with evidence scores
Retrieve drug-target evidence from multiple data types
Access tractability and safety data for targets
Find known drugs and clinical trial phases for diseases
Search entities by gene symbol, disease name, or drug name
Evaluate target druggability across small molecule, antibody, and PROTAC modalities
limitations: Requires biological interpretation of association scores
Under-studied diseases may have limited evidence
API is optimized for exploratory queries, not bulk analyses
Does not provide clinical decision support or recommendations

use_cases.title: Prioritize therapeutic targets
use_cases.description: Evaluate candidate genes using genetic evidence, tractability scores, and safety data from multiple sources.

use_cases.title: Find evidence for genes
use_cases.description: Search for supporting evidence linking genes to diseases using GWAS, literature, and pathway data.

use_cases.title: Map drug development landscape
use_cases.description: Identify drugs in clinical trials for a target and assess the competitive pipeline.

prompt_templates.title: Search target
prompt_templates.prompt: Use opentargets-database to search for BRCA1 and retrieve target information including tractability, safety liabilities, and associated diseases with scores.

prompt_templates.title: Find disease targets
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for Alzheimer's disease using opentargets-database, then retrieve the top 10 associated targets with their evidence scores.

prompt_templates.title: Get drug information
prompt_templates.prompt: Use opentargets-database to get information about aspirin (CHEMBL25) including mechanism of action, drug type, and clinical trial phases.

prompt_templates.title: Evidence analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Use opentargets-database to retrieve detailed evidence for the association between a gene and disease, filtering by genetic_association and known_drug data types.

output_examples.input: Search for IL6 gene and show its tractability, safety concerns, and top disease associations
output: Tractability: High (Clinical precedence for antibody modality)
Safety liabilities: Cytokine release syndrome, immune modulation
- Rheumatoid arthritis (score: 0.89) - genetic + known drug evidence

output_examples.input: Find drugs in clinical trials for a cancer target and show their phases
output: Drugs targeting EGFR with clinical activity:
- Cetuximab (Phase 4) - Colorectal and head and neck cancer

output_examples.input: Show evidence connecting a GWAS hit to a disease
output: Evidence for LRRK2 and Parkinson's disease:
- GWAS Catalog: Lead SNP rs76904798 (OR: 1.16, p-value: 2e-22)
- Known drug: Safinamide approved for Parkinson's

best_practices: Start with genetic evidence (GWAS, ClinVar) as the strongest disease relevance indicator
Check tractability assessments to understand druggability before pursuing target validation
Review safety liabilities early to avoid targets with poor therapeutic windows
anti_patterns: Using association scores as clinical success probabilities instead of relative ranking metrics
Relying solely on text-mining literature evidence without manual validation
Ignoring genetic constraint (pLI scores) when assessing target safety

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. All tools can query the Open Targets API using the provided Python functions.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for the Open Targets API?
faq.answer: The GraphQL API is designed for exploratory queries. For systematic analyses of many targets, use data downloads or Google BigQuery instead.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my existing workflows?
faq.answer: Import the query_opentargets.py functions directly. Use search_entities to find IDs, then pass them to get_target_info, get_disease_info, or other functions.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only makes read-only requests to Open Targets servers. No user data is stored or transmitted beyond the query parameters sent to the API.

faq.question: Why do some diseases have low scores despite strong evidence?
faq.answer: Association scores rank targets relative to each other within a disease. Under-studied or rare diseases may have lower scores due to limited research.

faq.question: How does this compare to similar tools?
faq.answer: Open Targets integrates 20+ data sources including GWAS Catalog, ClinVar, ChEMBL, and Reactome. It provides standardized evidence with unified scoring across sources.
